023import java.util.ArrayList;
024import java.util.Collections;
025import java.util.Iterator;
026import java.util.LinkedHashMap;
027import java.util.LinkedHashSet;
028import java.util.Map;
029import java.util.Set;
030import java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap;
031import java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantLock;
032
033import org.apache.commons.configuration2.Configuration;
034import org.apache.commons.lang3.StringUtils;
035import org.apache.logging.log4j.LogManager;
036import org.apache.logging.log4j.Logger;
037
038/**
039 * A generic implementation of a <code>ServiceBroker</code> which
040 * provides:
041 *
042 * <ul>
043 * <li>Maintaining service name to class name mapping, allowing
044 * pluggable service implementations.</li>
045 * <li>Providing <code>Services</code> with a configuration based on
046 * system wide configuration mechanism.</li>
047 * <li>Integration of TurbineServiceProviders for looking up
048 * non-local services</li>
049 * </ul>
050 *
051 * @author <a href="mailto:burton@apache.org">Kevin Burton</a>
052 * @author <a href="mailto:krzewski@e-point.pl">Rafal Krzewski</a>
053 * @author <a href="mailto:dlr@finemaltcoding.com">Daniel Rall</a>
054 * @author <a href="mailto:jvanzyl@apache.org">Jason van Zyl</a>
055 * @author <a href="mailto:mpoeschl@marmot.at">Martin Poeschl</a>
056 * @author <a href="mailto:hps@intermeta.de">Henning P. Schmiedehausen</a>
057 * @version $Id$
058 */
059public abstract class BaseServiceBroker implements ServiceBroker
060{
061    /**
062     * Mapping of Service names to class names, keep order.
063     */
064    private final Map<String, Class<?>> mapping = new LinkedHashMap<>();
065
066    /**
067     * A repository of Service instances.
068     */
069    private final ConcurrentHashMap<String, Service> services = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
070
071    /**
072     * Lock access during service initialization
073     */
074    private final ReentrantLock serviceLock = new ReentrantLock();
075
076    /**
077     * Configuration for the services broker.
078     * The configuration should be set by the application
079     * in which the services framework is running.
080     */
081    private Configuration configuration;
082
083    /**
084     * A prefix for <code>Service</code> properties in
085     * TurbineResource.properties.
086     */
087    public static final String SERVICE_PREFIX = "services.";
088
089    /**
090     * A <code>Service</code> property determining its implementing
091     * class name .
092     */
093    public static final String CLASSNAME_SUFFIX = ".classname";
094
095    /**
096     * These are objects that the parent application
097     * can provide so that application specific
098     * services have a mechanism to retrieve specialized
099     * information. For example, in Turbine there are services
100     * that require the RunData object: these services can
101     * retrieve the RunData object that Turbine has placed
102     * in the service manager. This alleviates us of
103     * the requirement of having init(Object) all
104     * together.
105     */
106    private final ConcurrentHashMap<String, Object> serviceObjects = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
107
108    /** Logging */
109    private static final Logger log = LogManager.getLogger(BaseServiceBroker.class);
110
111    /**
112     * Application root path as set by the
113     * parent application.
114     */
115    private String applicationRoot;
116
117    /**
118     * mapping from service names to instances of TurbineServiceProviders
119     */
120    private final ConcurrentHashMap<String, Service> serviceProviderInstanceMap = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
121
122    /**
123     * Default constructor, protected as to only be usable by subclasses.
124     *
125     * This constructor does nothing.
126     */
127    protected BaseServiceBroker()
128    {
129        // nothing to do
130    }
131
132    /**
133     * Set the configuration object for the services broker.
134     * This is the configuration that contains information
135     * about all services in the care of this service
136     * manager.
137     *
138     * @param configuration Broker configuration.
139     */
140    public void setConfiguration(Configuration configuration)
141    {
142        this.configuration = configuration;
143    }
144
145    /**
146     * Get the configuration for this service manager.
147     *
148     * @return Broker configuration.
149     */
150    public Configuration getConfiguration()
151    {
152        return configuration;
153    }
154
155    /**
156     * Initialize this service manager.
157     * @throws InitializationException if the initialization fails
158     */
159    public void init() throws InitializationException
160    {
161        // Check:
162        //
163        // 1. The configuration has been set.
164        // 2. Make sure the application root has been set.
165
166        // FIXME: Make some service framework exceptions to throw in
167        // the event these requirements aren't satisfied.
168
169        // Create the mapping between service names
170        // and their classes.
171        initMapping();
172
173        // Start services that have their 'earlyInit'
174        // property set to 'true'.
175        initServices(false);
176    }
177
178    /**
179     * Set an application specific service object
180     * that can be used by application specific
181     * services.
182     *
183     * @param name name of service object
184     * @param value value of service object
185     */
186    public void setServiceObject(String name, Object value)
187    {
188        serviceObjects.put(name, value);
189    }
190
191    /**
192     * Get an application specific service object.
193     *
194     * @param name the name of the service object
195     * @return Object application specific service object
196     */
197    public Object getServiceObject(String name)
198    {
199        return serviceObjects.get(name);
200    }
201
202    /**
203     * Check recursively if the given checkIfc interface is among the implemented
204     * interfaces
205     *
206     * @param checkIfc interface to check for
207     * @param interfaces interfaces to scan
208     * @return true if the interface is implemented
209     */
210    private boolean checkForInterface(Class<?> checkIfc, Class<?>[] interfaces)
211    {
212        for (Class<?> ifc : interfaces)
213        {
214            if (ifc == checkIfc)
215            {
216                return true;
217            }
218
219            Class<?>[] subInterfaces = ifc.getInterfaces();
220            if (checkForInterface(checkIfc, subInterfaces))
221            {
222                return true;
223            }
224        }
225
226        return false;
227    }
228
229    /**
230     * Creates a mapping between Service names and class names.
231     *
232     * The mapping is built according to settings present in
233     * TurbineResources.properties.  The entries should have the
234     * following form:
235     *
236     * <pre>
237     * services.MyService.classname=com.mycompany.MyServiceImpl
238     * services.MyOtherService.classname=com.mycompany.MyOtherServiceImpl
239     * </pre>
240     *
241     * <br>
242     *
243     * Generic ServiceBroker provides no Services.
244     * @throws InitializationException if a service class could not be found
245     */
246    protected void initMapping() throws InitializationException
247    {
248        // we need to temporarily store the earlyInit flags to avoid
249        // ConcurrentModificationExceptions
250        Map<String, String> earlyInitFlags = new LinkedHashMap<>();
251
252        /*
253         * These keys returned in an order that corresponds
254         * to the order the services are listed in
255         * the TR.props.
256         */
257        for (Iterator<String> keys = configuration.getKeys(); keys.hasNext();)
258        {
259            String key = keys.next();
260            String[] keyParts = StringUtils.split(key, ".");
261
262            if (keyParts.length == 3
263                    && (keyParts[0] + ".").equals(SERVICE_PREFIX)
264                    && ("." + keyParts[2]).equals(CLASSNAME_SUFFIX))
265            {
266                String serviceKey = keyParts[1];
267                log.info("Added Mapping for Service: {}", serviceKey);
268
269                if (!mapping.containsKey(serviceKey))
270                {
271                    String className = configuration.getString(key);
272                    try
273                    {
274                        Class<?> clazz = Class.forName(className);
275                        mapping.put(serviceKey, clazz);
276
277                        // detect TurbineServiceProviders
278                        if (checkForInterface(TurbineServiceProvider.class, clazz.getInterfaces()))
279                        {
280                            log.info("Found a TurbineServiceProvider: {} - initializing it early", serviceKey);
281                            earlyInitFlags.put(SERVICE_PREFIX + serviceKey + ".earlyInit", "true");
282                        }
283                    }
284                    // those two errors must be passed to the VM
285                    catch (ThreadDeath t)
286                    {
287                        throw t;
288                    }
289                    catch (OutOfMemoryError t)
290                    {
291                        throw t;
292                    }
293                    catch (ClassNotFoundException | NoClassDefFoundError e)
294                    {
295                        throw new InitializationException("Class " + className +
296                            " is unavailable. Check your jars and classes.", e);
297                    }
298                }
299            }
300        }
301
302        for (Map.Entry<String, String> entry : earlyInitFlags.entrySet())
303        {
304            configuration.setProperty(entry.getKey(), entry.getValue());
305        }
306    }
307
308    /**
309     * Determines whether a service is registered in the configured
310     * <code>TurbineResources.properties</code>.
311     *
312     * @param serviceName The name of the service whose existence to check.
313     * @return Registration predicate for the desired services.
314     */
315    @Override
316    public boolean isRegistered(String serviceName)
317    {
318        return (services.get(serviceName) != null);
319    }
320
321    /**
322     * Returns an Iterator over all known service names.
323     *
324     * @return An Iterator of service names.
325     */
326    public Iterator<String> getServiceNames()
327    {
328        return Collections.unmodifiableSet(mapping.keySet()).iterator();
329    }
330
331    /**
332     * Returns an Iterator over all known service names beginning with
333     * the provided prefix.
334     *
335     * @param prefix The prefix against which to test.
336     * @return An Iterator of service names which match the prefix.
337     */
338    public Iterator<String> getServiceNames(String prefix)
339    {
340        Set<String> keys = new LinkedHashSet<>(mapping.keySet());
341
342        keys.removeIf(key -> !key.startsWith(prefix));
343
344        return Collections.unmodifiableSet(keys).iterator();
345    }
346
347    /**
348     * Performs early initialization of specified service.
349     *
350     * @param name The name of the service (generally the
351     * <code>SERVICE_NAME</code> constant of the service's interface
352     * definition).
353     * @throws InitializationException Initialization of this
354     * service was not successful.
355     */
356    @Override
357    public void initService(String name)
358            throws InitializationException
359    {
360        // Calling getServiceInstance(name) assures that the Service
361        // implementation has its name and broker reference set before
362        // initialization.
363        Service instance = getServiceInstance(name);
364        
365        serviceLock.lock();
366        try {
367            if (!instance.getInit())
368            {
369                // this call might result in an indirect recursion
370                instance.init();
371            }
372            
373        } finally {
374            serviceLock.unlock();
375        }
376    }
377
378    /**
379     * Performs early initialization of all services.  Failed early
380     * initialization of a Service may be non-fatal to the system,
381     * thus any exceptions are logged and the initialization process
382     * continues.
383     */
384    public void initServices()
385    {
386        try
387        {
388            initServices(false);
389        }
390        catch (InstantiationException | InitializationException notThrown)
391        {
392            log.debug("Caught non fatal exception", notThrown);
393        }
394    }
395
396    /**
397     * Performs early initialization of all services. You can decide
398     * to handle failed initializations if you wish, but then
399     * after one service fails, the other will not have the chance
400     * to initialize.
401     *
402     * @param report <code>true</code> if you want exceptions thrown.
403     * @throws InstantiationException if the service could not be instantiated
404     * @throws InitializationException if the service could not be initialized
405     */
406    public void initServices(boolean report)
407            throws InstantiationException, InitializationException
408    {
409        if (report)
410        {
411            // Throw exceptions
412            for (Iterator<String> names = getServiceNames(); names.hasNext();)
413            {
414                doInitService(names.next());
415            }
416        }
417        else
418        {
419            // Eat exceptions
420            for (Iterator<String> names = getServiceNames(); names.hasNext();)
421            {
422                try
423                {
424                    doInitService(names.next());
425                }
426                        // In case of an exception, file an error message; the
427                        // system may be still functional, though.
428                catch (InstantiationException | InitializationException e)
429                {
430                    log.error(e);
431                }
432            }
433        }
434        log.info("Finished initializing all services!");
435    }
436
437    /**
438     * Internal utility method for use in {@link #initServices(boolean)}
439     * to prevent duplication of code.
440     */
441    private void doInitService(String name)
442            throws InstantiationException, InitializationException
443    {
444        // Only start up services that have their earlyInit flag set.
445        if (getConfiguration(name).getBoolean("earlyInit", false))
446        {
447            log.info("Start Initializing service (early): {}", name);
448            initService(name);
449            log.info("Finish Initializing service (early): {}", name);
450        }
451    }
452
453    /**
454     * Shuts down a <code>Service</code>, releasing resources
455     * allocated by an <code>Service</code>, and returns it to its
456     * initial (uninitialized) state.
457     *
458     * @param name The name of the <code>Service</code> to be
459     * uninitialized.
460     */
461    @Override
462    public void shutdownService(String name)
463    {
464        try
465        {
466            Service service = getServiceInstance(name);
467            if (service != null && service.getInit())
468            {
469                serviceLock.lock();
470                try {
471                    service.shutdown();
472    
473                    if (service.getInit() && service instanceof BaseService)
474                    {
475                        // BaseService::shutdown() does this by default,
476                        // but could've been overriden poorly.
477                        ((BaseService) service).setInit(false);
478                    }
479                } finally {
480                    serviceLock.unlock();
481                }
482            }
483        }
484        catch (InstantiationException e)
485        {
486            // Assuming harmless -- log the error and continue.
487            log.error("Shutdown of a nonexistent Service '"
488                    + name + "' was requested", e);
489        }
490    }
491
492    /**
493     * Shuts down all Turbine services, releasing allocated resources and
494     * returning them to their initial (uninitialized) state.
495     */
496    @Override
497    public void shutdownServices()
498    {
499        log.info("Shutting down all services!");
500
501        String serviceName = null;
502
503        /*
504         * Now we want to reverse the order of
505         * this list. This functionality should be added to
506         * the ExtendedProperties in the commons but
507         * this will fix the problem for now.
508         */
509
510        ArrayList<String> reverseServicesList = new ArrayList<>();
511
512        for (Iterator<String> serviceNames = getServiceNames(); serviceNames.hasNext();)
513        {
514            serviceName = serviceNames.next();
515            reverseServicesList.add(0, serviceName);
516        }
517
518        for (String s : reverseServicesList)
519        {
520            serviceName = s;
521            log.info("Shutting down service: {}", serviceName);
522            shutdownService(serviceName);
523        }
524    }
525
526    /**
527     * Returns an instance of requested Service.
528     *
529     * @param name The name of the Service requested.
530     * @return An instance of requested Service.
531     * @throws InstantiationException if the service is unknown or
532     * can't be initialized.
533     */
534    @Override
535    public Object getService(String name) throws InstantiationException
536    {
537        Service service;
538
539        if (this.isLocalService(name))
540        {
541                try
542                {
543                    service = getServiceInstance(name);
544                    if (!service.getInit())
545                    {
546                        serviceLock.lock(); // was synchronized (service.getClass(), but should be equivalent
547                        try {
548                            if (!service.getInit())
549                            {
550                                log.info("Start Initializing service (late): {}", name);
551                                service.init();
552                                log.info("Finish Initializing service (late): {}", name);
553                            }
554                        } finally {
555                            serviceLock.unlock();
556                        }
557                    }
558                    if (!service.getInit())
559                    {
560                        // this exception will be caught & rethrown by this very method.
561                        // getInit() returning false indicates some initialization issue,
562                        // which in turn prevents the InitableBroker from passing a
563                        // reference to a working instance of the initable to the client.
564                        throw new InitializationException(
565                                "init() failed to initialize service " + name);
566                    }
567                    return service;
568                }
569                catch (InitializationException e)
570                {
571                    throw new InstantiationException("Service " + name +
572                            " failed to initialize", e);
573                }
574        }
575        else if (this.isNonLocalService(name))
576        {
577            return this.getNonLocalService(name);
578        }
579        else
580        {
581            throw new InstantiationException(
582                "ServiceBroker: unknown service " + name
583                + " requested");
584        }
585    }
586
587    /**
588     * Retrieves an instance of a Service without triggering late
589     * initialization.
590     *
591     * Early initialization of a Service can require access to Service
592     * properties.  The Service must have its name and serviceBroker
593     * set by then.  Therefore, before calling
594     * Initable.initClass(Object), the class must be instantiated with
595     * InitableBroker.getInitableInstance(), and
596     * Service.setServiceBroker() and Service.setName() must be
597     * called.  This calls for two - level accessing the Services
598     * instances.
599     *
600     * @param name The name of the service requested.
601     *
602     * @return the Service instance
603     *
604     * @throws InstantiationException The service is unknown or
605     * can't be initialized.
606     */
607    protected Service getServiceInstance(String name)
608            throws InstantiationException
609    {
610        Service service = services.get(name);
611
612        if (service == null)
613        {
614            serviceLock.lock();
615
616            try
617            {
618                // Double check
619                service = services.get(name);
620
621                if (service == null)
622                {
623                    if (!this.isLocalService(name))
624                    {
625                        throw new InstantiationException(
626                                "ServiceBroker: unknown service " + name
627                                + " requested");
628                    }
629
630                    try
631                    {
632                        Class<?> clazz = mapping.get(name);
633
634                        try
635                        {
636                            service = (Service) clazz.getDeclaredConstructor().newInstance();
637
638                            // check if the newly created service is also a
639                            // service provider - if so then remember it
640                            if (service instanceof TurbineServiceProvider)
641                            {
642                                Service _service = this.serviceProviderInstanceMap.putIfAbsent(name,service);
643                                if (_service != null)
644                                {
645                                    service = _service;
646                                }
647                            }
648                        }
649                        // those two errors must be passed to the VM
650                        catch (ClassCastException e)
651                        {
652                            throw new InstantiationException("Class " + clazz +
653                                    " doesn't implement the Service interface", e);
654                        }
655                        catch (ThreadDeath | OutOfMemoryError t)
656                        {
657                            throw t;
658                        }
659                        catch (Throwable t)
660                        {
661                            throw new InstantiationException("Failed to instantiate " + clazz, t);
662                        }
663                    }
664                    catch (InstantiationException e)
665                    {
666                        throw new InstantiationException(
667                                "Failed to instantiate service " + name, e);
668                    }
669                    service.setServiceBroker(this);
670                    service.setName(name);
671                    Service _service = services.putIfAbsent(name, service);
672                    if (_service != null) // Unlikely
673                    {
674                        service = _service;
675                    }
676                }
677            }
678            finally
679            {
680                serviceLock.unlock();
681            }
682        }
683
684        return service;
685    }
686
687    /**
688     * Returns the configuration for the specified service.
689     *
690     * @param name The name of the service.
691     * @return Configuration of requested Service.
692     */
693    @Override
694    public Configuration getConfiguration(String name)
695    {
696        return configuration.subset(SERVICE_PREFIX + name);
697    }
698
699    /**
700     * Set the application root.
701     *
702     * @param applicationRoot application root
703     */
704    public void setApplicationRoot(String applicationRoot)
705    {
706        this.applicationRoot = applicationRoot;
707    }
708
709    /**
710     * Get the application root as set by
711     * the parent application.
712     *
713     * @return String application root
714     */
715    @Override
716    public String getApplicationRoot()
717    {
718        return applicationRoot;
719    }
720
721    /**
722     * Determines if the requested service is managed by this
723     * ServiceBroker.
724     *
725     * @param name The name of the Service requested.
726     * @return true if the service is managed by the this ServiceBroker
727     */
728    protected boolean isLocalService(String name)
729    {
730        return this.mapping.containsKey(name);
731    }
732
733    /**
734     * Determines if the requested service is managed by an initialized
735     * TurbineServiceProvider. We use the service names to lookup
736     * the TurbineServiceProvider to ensure that we get a fully
737     * initialized service.
738     *
739     * @param name The name of the Service requested.
740     * @return true if the service is managed by a TurbineServiceProvider
741     */
742    protected boolean isNonLocalService(String name)
743    {
744        TurbineServiceProvider turbineServiceProvider = null;
745
746        for (Map.Entry<String, Service> entry : this.serviceProviderInstanceMap.entrySet())
747        {
748            turbineServiceProvider = (TurbineServiceProvider) this.getService(entry.getKey());
749
750            if (turbineServiceProvider.exists(name))
751            {
752                return true;
753            }
754        }
755
756        return false;
757    }
758
759    /**
760     * Get a non-local service managed by a TurbineServiceProvider.
761     *
762     * @param name The name of the Service requested.
763     * @return the requested service
764     * @throws InstantiationException the service couldn't be instantiated
765     */
766    protected Object getNonLocalService(String name)
767        throws InstantiationException
768    {
769        TurbineServiceProvider turbineServiceProvider = null;
770
771        for (Map.Entry<String, Service> entry : this.serviceProviderInstanceMap.entrySet())
772        {
773            turbineServiceProvider = (TurbineServiceProvider) this.getService(entry.getKey());
774
775            if (turbineServiceProvider.exists(name))
776            {
777                return turbineServiceProvider.get(name);
778            }
779        }
780
781        throw new InstantiationException(
782            "ServiceBroker: unknown non-local service " + name
783            + " requested");
784    }
785}
